document_data.name: ''Blackguard's Plate''
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Blackguard's plate''''' was a set of ornate [[enchanted]] [[plate mail]] that was once worn by a [[blackguard]] and later by a [[death knight]] they became.

{{quote|''To break one's oath is a dangerous game - it marks you as a faithless cur, an exile without a cause. The armour is tempered by an age of rocks, blades, and persecution turned against it - and is buffed by the immutable, unbindable will of its wearer.''}}
document_data.Powers: The ''blackguard's plate'' possessed a ''+1'' defensive enchantment that not just blocked enemy strikes but also reduced all incoming damage. Its magic also gave the wearer streamer steeled mind that made it harder for the wearer fall under the effects of various mind-altering magics and abilities.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, ''blackguard's plate'' were worn by the guardian death knight called [[That Which Guards]], who, along with [[That Which Lurks (death knight)|That Which Lurks]] and [[That Which Watches]], guarded the entrance to the chamber of the [[Bhaalist]] [[Murder Tribunal]] in the [[Undercellar]] of [[Baldur's Gate]].
